modName: Sci Fi Display Cases - Dwemer and Yautja
summary: Sci-Fi retextures of the display cases.  Available as a replacer or modder's resource.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#999999][size=3][i]This is a simple sci-fi retexture for display cases.  The mod is purely cosmetic: these new display cases do not have any new special features.[/i][/size][/color]

[u][color=#999999][size=3][b]Requirements/Conflicts[/b][/size][/color][/u]
[list]
[*][size=2][color=#ff7700][s]Probably does NOT work for SSE.[/s][/color]  I don't have the special edition, so I can't test it myself, but a user was kind enough to give it a try and [color=#00ff00]it seems to work with SSE![/color][/size]
[*][size=2]No requirements.[/size]
[*][size=2]The replacer versions will conflict with other display case retexture mods.[/size]
[/list]
[u][b][size=3][color=#999999]Three styles to choose from:[/color]
[/size][/b][/u]
[list]
[*][color=#00ffff][size=3]Dwemer:[/size][/color][size=2] Gold/dwemer metal with a glowing cyan readout using Dwemer letters.  If you're trying to stay lore-friendly, this is the one you want.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][color=#ff0000][size=3]Yautja Silver:[/size][/color][size=2] Intended for users of the Lost Tribes mod (though you don't need Lost Tribes installed to use it).  Silver metal with a glowing red readout using Yautja letters.  Not remotely lore friendly![/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][color=#00ffff][size=3]Yautja Gold:[/size][/color][size=2] Uses the dwemer color scheme (gold & cyan), but yautja letters.  Since the Lost Tribes mod uses a lot of dwemer meshes and textures, this style is meant to offer a little yautja flavor without looking out of place.[/size]
[/list]

[color=#999999][b][u][size=3]Installation[/size][/u][/b]
[/color]To retexture all display cases in the game, pick your favorite style (Dwemer, Yautja Silver, or Yautja Gold) and download the replacer version.  Install it like a normal mod, either using NMM or unzip it into your Data folder. [color=#ff0000] [/color][color=#ff7700]Install only ONE replacer version at a time.[/color]

If you're a modder, download the ModdersResource version to get the meshes and textures for all three styles.  The ModdersResource version won't affect in-game display cases until you actually use it as part of a mod.

[size=3][b][color=#999999][u]To Uninstall[/u][/color][/b]
[/size]I recommend installing & uninstalling via NMM, but if you REALLY want to do it manually...

[i]To uninstall a replacer version, delete the following:[/i]
Data/Meshes/Clutter/DisplayCases/displaycaselgangled01.nif
Data/Meshes/Clutter/DisplayCases/displaycaselgflag01.nif
Data/Meshes/Clutter/DisplayCases/displaycasesmangled01.nif
Data/Meshes/Clutter/DisplayCases/displaycasesmflag01.nif
Data/Textures/SciFi_DisplayCase

[i]To uninstall/remove the modder's resource version, delete the following:[/i]
Data/Meshes/SciFi_DisplayCase
Data/Textures/SciFi_DisplayCase

[u][b][color=#999999][size=3]Credits[/size][/color][/b][/u]
Textures were constructed using vanilla Skyrim textures, a screencap from the Predator franchise, plus [url=https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/564x/11/b0/63/11b0634f5bf660b9040da8bbb6eb6cfc.jpg]this image[/url].  As far as I can tell, this image has no owner or listed artist, but if I've made a mistake, please let me know.  I will either give you credit or pull down the mod, as you prefer.

[color=#999999][size=3][b][u]Permissions[/u][/b][/size][/color]
As long as you're not making money from it, feel free to use this mod and its assets however you like!  A note for my contribution to your project is always welcome, but I'm not going to be a stickler about it.
author: DaedricSaber1701
